title: Riviera Salad
introduction: This vibrant and refreshing Riviera Salad, popular from Italy to France, is a delightful mix of boiled potatoes, ripe tomatoes, crisp cucumbers, and bell peppers. Accented with anchovy fillets and olives, and topped with fresh basil leaves, this salad offers a beautiful medley of textures and flavors. The salad is beautifully finished with a simple vinaigrette and garnished with quartered eggs, making it a perfect dish for any occasion.
ingredients: 1 small cucumber, peeled and sliced ¼ inch thick
1 small red or yellow bell pepper, cut into narrow strips
6 anchovy fillets, cut into 5 or 6 pieces
½ cup pitted green olives, rinsed and drained and coarsely chopped
instructions: 1. Place the potatoes in a saucepan with cold water to cover and salt to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and peel the potatoes. Cut them into ¼-inch-thick slices.

2. Meanwhile, place the eggs in a small saucepan with cold water to cover. Bring the water to a simmer. Cook for 12 minutes. Let the eggs cool under cold running water. Drain and peel. Cut the eggs into quarters.
3. In a large serving bowl, combine the potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, anchovies, and olives. Scatter the basil leaves on top.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently. Garnish with the eggs. Serve immediately.
